info.author: Xing Wang
info.description: # SciNode [![Unit test](https://github.com/scinode/scinode/actions/workflows/scinode_test.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/scinode/scinode/actions/workflows/scinode_test.yaml) A platform for designing node-based workflows for science and engineering. **Features** - easy to design computational workflow and reusable components using GUI. - execute the workflow on local or remote computer. - can run without GUI, for high throughput calculation. - visualize the data. - ScinodeHub, containing hundreds of ready-to-use components and workflow template, accessible to everyone. - ScinodeServer provide collaboration, management and depolymnet. **Different from other node-base workflow** - Nodetree data is stored in the database. A nodetree can be fully reconstructed the database. - For long running jobs, thus the execution does not provide instant feedback. Installation ========================================== .. code-block:: console pip install --upgrade --user scinode Documentation ------------------- Check the [docs](https://scinode.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) and learn about the features. Examples --------------------- **A simple math calculation** Publish to pypi ----------------- .. code-block:: console python setup.py sdist bdist_wheel python -m twine upload dist/* License ---- [MIT](http://opensource.org/licenses/MIT) ## Call for Contributions This project is under heavy development at this stage. We appreciate and welcome contributions. ## ToDo ### Enhancement - modify nodetree and launch - backup previous daemon logfile - provide two modes: (1) pickle and (2) json - support context, which can passed to node - daemon to support multi-processes (cpus) - concatenate json file. e.g remove `from_node_name` text in links.
info.name: scinode
